name: epitaxy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the growth of a thin crystal (= any solid consisting of atoms or molecules that are arranged in a regular structure) on top of another crystal, with both having a similar shape and structure: Modern solar cells are built with epitaxy and convert sunlight into useful energy. Molecular beam epitaxy is a way of creating perfect crystals, one layer of atoms at a time.
More examplesFewer examplesThe coatings are formed using a variety of techniques, including epitaxy.Epitaxy allows us to construct a crystalline structure of atoms, with each layer just a few atoms thick.Epitaxy is a method for growing single crystals on a growing film surface.The development of epitaxy allowed us to have far more precision in the process.
